tagged_story_for_tts:
<[silence:3600]>

The word locomotion enters English in the seventeenth century <[silence:1200]>
from the Latin locus, meaning place <[silence:250]> and motio, meaning movement <[silence:1200]>
It describes the ability of organisms—or machines—to move from one location to another <[silence:3600]>

Three related concepts are ambulation <[silence:250]> propulsion <[silence:250]> and kinematics <[silence:3600]>
